topics.body:
"@Number1pegasus":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55b426636368720af8001436#post_55b426636368720af8001436
You are not _just a drop out_ 
Nothing about your personality tells me you would just one day stop going to school just because 
With what I've heard of your family, you dropped out for the same reason as me. There was shit going on at home and it became too much for you to handle all at once. The only thing you can do is take things in stride and make progress in a way that works for you. 

This is sort of tangential to the current conversation and maybe I'm completely wrong but I had that feeling of being such a huge failure because I stopped going to school for so long and it's awful. Yes, going to school is important but keeping yourself from being absolutely miserable can be just as important. Just so long as you're always making progress whether it's school, helping at home, a job, art, anything.

I really need to get back to getting my GED. I'm just always stressed all the time. 

Plus my giant lack of confidence.
